title: Read-only properties cannot be overridden by the user when creating a COMPANY
description: Read-only properties are for example \`ID\`, \`created\_at\` and \`updated\_at\`. Analog to unknown properties, those fields will be ignored. They will not be processed and there will be no info, warning or error that they were skipped.

title: Unknown properties are ignored when creating a COMPANY
description: The user can provide properties that are not specified in the epic MCA-201, but they will be completely ignored. They will not be processed and there will be no info, warning or error that they were skipped.

title: The response contains all specified properties when creating a COMPANY
description: All properties are returned that are specified in the epic MCA-201. When properties are empty they are returned with null values. IDs, timestamp and other meta information might be included too, but is not in the scope of this AC.

title: Requests to create a COMPANY are rejected when the provided data is invalid
description: Data is invalid when its structure is incorrect, has syntax errors or does not contain all mandatory fields.

title: Requests to create a COMPANY are accepted when the provided data is valid
description: Data is valid when its structure is correct, has no syntax errors and contains all mandatory fields.

title: Requesting to delete a non-existing has-prime-image relationship is rejected with an error
Deletion requests are rejected with an error when the provided data is invalid
description:
* invalid data:
  * CAR MODEL with given ID does not exists
  * IMAGE with given ID does not exists

title: The has-prime-image relationship is deleted when provided with valid data
description:
* invalid data:
  * CAR MODEL with given ID does not exists
  * IMAGE with given ID does not exists

title: Requesting a non-existing has-prime-image relationship is rejected with an error
Requests are rejected with an error when the provided data is invalid
description:
* invalid data:
  * CAR MODEL with given ID does not exists
  * IMAGE with given ID does not exists

title: The has-prime-image relationship is returned when provided with valid data
description:
* valid data:
  * CAR MODEL with given ID exists
  * IMAGE with given ID exists
* response:
  * `car_model_id`: integer
  * `image_id`: integer
  * `relationship_id`: integer
  * `relationship_name`: string → `has-prime-image`

title: Requests are rejected with an error when the provided data is invalid
description:
* invalid data:
  * CAR MODEL with given ID does not exists

title: An empty response is returned when there exists no has-prime-image relationship for the CAR MODEL
The has-prime-image relationship is returned when provided with valid data
description:
* valid data:
  * CAR MODEL with given ID exists
* response:
  * `car_model_id`: integer
  * `image_id`: integer
  * `relationship_id`: integer
  * `relationship_name`: string → `has-prime-image`

title: Creating the same has-prime-image relationship again returns the already existing one
Creation requests are rejected with an error when the provided data is invalid
description:
* invalid data:
  * CAR MODEL with given ID does not exists
  * IMAGE with given ID does not exists

title: A CAR MODEL cannot have more than one prime IMAGE
Connecting a different prime IMAGE to the CAR MODEL deletes the previous has-prime-image relationship
The has-prime-image relationship is created when provided with valid data
description:
* valid data:
  * CAR MODEL with given ID exists
  * IMAGE with given ID exists
* response:
  * `car_model_id`: integer
  * `image_id`: integer
  * `relationship_id`: integer
  * `relationship_name`: string → `has-prime-image`

title: An error is returned when the page number is out of range
description: * e.g. when there are `5` pages, but the user requests page `15`

title: Non-pagination requests contain pagination meta information
description: * e.g. `/car-models` returns the same fields as specified in <https://dennis-gerike.atlassian.net/browse/MCA-386>

title: The response for each pagination request contains pagination meta information
description:
* additional fields in the response:
  * `page`: number
  * `page-size`: number
  * `total-pages`: number
  * `total-items`: number

title: Requests with an invalid page number respond with an error
Each page contains different nodes
description: * e.g. when a node already appeared on page `1` it should not appear again on page `2`

title: Each page contains a pre-defined amount of nodes
description: * for the time being this number is always `100`, except for the last page

title: Pagination is available for each node type
Hard deleting an IMAGE removes all attached RELATIONSHIPs
Requesting the deletion of a non-existing IMAGE is rejected with an error
Hard deleting an IMAGE does permanently delete it
Hard deleting a BRAND removes all attached RELATIONSHIPs
Requesting the deletion of a non-existing BRAND is rejected with an error
Hard deleting a BRAND does permanently delete it
Hard deleting a CAR MODEL removes all attached RELATIONSHIPs
Requesting the deletion of a non-existing CAR MODEL is rejected with an error
Hard deleting a CAR MODEL does permanently delete it
An error is returned when the specified IMAGE does not exist
All groups in the returned object are empty when no NODEs are attached to the IMAGE
All attached NODEs are returned, grouped by NODE type
A "not found" error is returned when the relationship between BRAND and IMAGE does not exist
A "not found" error is returned when the BRAND or IMAGE does not exist
The relationship between BRAND and IMAGE is returned when it exists
A "not found" error is returned when the relationship between BRAND and CAR MODEL does not exist
A "not found" error is returned when the BRAND or CAR MODEL does not exist
The relationship between BRAND and CAR MODEL is returned when it exists
A "not found" error is returned when the relationship between CAR MODEL and IMAGE does not exist
A "not found" error is returned when the CAR MODEL or IMAGE does not exist
The relationship between CAR MODEL and IMAGE is returned when it exists
Read-only properties cannot be overridden by the user when creating a BRAND
An error is returned when the specified BRAND does not exist
An empty list is returned when there are no IMAGEs attached
A list of all attached IMAGEs can be requested
Multiple IMAGEs can be attached to a BRAND
The same relationship between the same nodes can only exist once
A 404 error is returned when any of the two nodes does not exist
Any existing IMAGE can be connected to any existing BRAND
An error is returned when the specified CAR MODEL does not exist
An empty list is returned when there are no IMAGEs attached
A list of all attached IMAGEs can be requested
Multiple IMAGEs can be connected to a CAR MODEL
The same relationship between the same nodes can only exist once
A 404 error is returned when any of the two nodes does not exist
Any existing IMAGE can be connected to any existing CAR MODEL
Updating a RELATIONSHIP does not change its ID
Updating a NODE does not change its ID
Custom IDs are not allowed when updating a NODE
description: when the user sends an ID it will be ignored

title: Custom IDs are not allowed when creating a NODE
description: when the user sends an ID it will be ignored

title: RELATIONSHIPs are created with 8-digit IDs
NODEs are created with 8-digit IDs
An error is returned when the specified BRAND does not exist
An empty list is returned when no CAR MODEL is attached
All attached CAR MODELs are returned
An error is returned when the specified CAR MODEL does not exist
An empty body is returned when there is no BRAND attached
The attached BRAND is returned
The same relationship between the same nodes can only exist once
description:
* trying to create the same relationship again 
  * does not negate it (it’s not an on/off switch)
  * does not create a new connection in the database (no duplicates allowed)
* no matter how often the request is triggered, the result will always be the same (idempotency)
  * the ID of the relationship does not change

title: A 404 error is returned when any of the two nodes does not exist
Connecting another BRAND to a CAR MODEL removes the original connection
Any existing BRAND can be connected to any existing CAR MODEL
Request is invalid when IMAGE and partner node are identical
Request returns a NOT FOUND error when there exists no connection between IMAGE and node
Request returns a NOT FOUND error when the IMAGE or partner node does not exists
When there exists a connection between IMAGE and node then that relationship is returned
Request returns a NOT FOUND error when the IMAGE does not exist
When the IMAGE is not connected to any node then an empty list is returned
When there exist nodes that are connected to the IMAGE then those relationships are returned
An IMAGE can be connected to multiple nodes of different type
An IMAGE can be connected to multiple nodes of the same type
An IMAGE cannot be connected to another IMAGE
An IMAGE cannot be connected to itself
The relationship ID does not change when the same relationship between the same nodes is created again
description:
* creating a new rel and creating the same rel again produces the identical response
* 201

title: The relationship creation is aborted when any of the two nodes don't exist
Any existing IMAGE can be connected to any existing non-IMAGE node
The IMAGE is created when the provided WIKIMEDIA ID is valid
The IMAGE is NOT created when the provided WIKIMEDIA ID is invalid
The IMAGE is created when the provided FLICKR ID is valid
The IMAGE is NOT created when the provided FLICKR ID is invalid
When creating an IMAGE the read-only properties cannot be overridden by the user
When no IMAGEs exist in the database then an empty list is returned
Requesting an IMAGE collection returns a list of all existing IMAGE nodes
The response for creating an IMAGE returns the new node with all specified properties
description:
* `external_id`: string
* `image_provider`: string
* `name`: string, (dummy-value)
* `description`: string/null, (dummy-value)
* `creator`: string, (dummy-value)
* `license`: string, (dummy-value)
* `tags`: string/null, (dummy-value)
* `source`: string, (dummy-value)
* `image_url_original`: string, (dummy-value)
* `image_url_xxl`: string/null, (dummy-value)
* `image_url_xl`: string/null, (dummy-value)
* `image_url_l`: string/null, (dummy-value)
* `image_url_m`: string/null, (dummy-value)
* `image_url_s`: string/null, (dummy-value)
* `image_url_xs`: string/null, (dummy-value)
